POLITICS.title: The right's looming war over AI - WORLD News Group
POLITICS.summary: Conservatives are increasingly expressing concerns over the effects of artificial intelligence (AI) on society and children. At the recent National Conservatism Conference, figures such as Senator Josh Hawley criticized the power and ideology of AI companies and warned against the potential dangers of transhumanism, which they argue undermines individual worth and liberty. While some speakers denounced the business models of AI companies, others emphasized the potential to steer the development of AI through political action, highlighting the need for dialogue and caution in managing AI's growth.

POLITICS.title: Trump's team keeps posting AI portraits of him. We keep clicking
POLITICS.summary: President Donald Trump and his administration have been using artificial intelligence (AI) to create and share fantastical images of the president on their social media accounts. These AI-generated images depict Trump in various heroic or powerful roles and, despite their clear artificiality, they continue to garner significant attention and engagement online. This trend reflects the growing appeal of AI-generated content, both for its ease of creation and its potential to reinforce subjective conceptions of reality.

POLITICS.title: Trump Shared And Then Deleted An AI-Generated Video Of Him ...
POLITICS.summary: President Donald Trump recently shared an AI-generated video on his Truth Social page, presenting a false Fox News segment where he allegedly announces a new healthcare system involving "medbed hospitals" and a national medbed card for every citizen. Medbed is a term associated with a conspiracy theory circulating in QAnon circles that pertains to secret medical beds purported to cure any condition. The video was subsequently deleted from Trump's page.

AI & EMERGING TECH.title: Reflexive AI: When Gen AI Becomes a New Business Default
AI & EMERGING TECH.summary: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) has become an instinctive first step rather than a conscious decision in many industries, changing from a curiosity to an obligation. AI has been integrated into various sectors, including banking for sales and client management, and payments for fraud detection, with a survey finding 98% of U.S. product leaders believe generative AI will reshape operations within three years. However, risks of reflexive AI adoption persist, such as potential bias amplification and regulatory issues.

AI & EMERGING TECH.title: AI could impact a million jobs in London, research suggests - BBC
AI & EMERGING TECH.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) could potentially change nearly a million jobs in London, affecting various sectors including telemarketing, bookkeeping, data entry, fast food, warehousing, retail, paralegal work, and proofreading, according to research by online CV company LiveCareer UK. The study also suggests that women are at higher risk due to their occupation of more roles susceptible to AI's impact. Meanwhile, the NHS is using AI to improve workflows, like in Queen Elizabeth Hospital's pharmacy where AI is used to optimize medication dispensing.

TECHNOLOGY.title: Anthropic launches Claude Sonnet 4.5, its latest AI model - CNBC
TECHNOLOGY.summary: Anthropic has launched its latest Artificial Intelligence model, Claude Sonnet 4.5, which is more efficient at coding, using computers, and meeting business needs. The Amazon-backed startup, valued at $183 billion, claims that the new model excels in areas such as cybersecurity, finance, and research, and is superior at generating high-quality code and identifying code improvements. The company plans further model launches in the near future.

TECHNOLOGY.title: Now AI is everywhere in businesses, is anyone actually using it?
TECHNOLOGY.summary: Atlassian's latest research reveals that daily AI use has nearly doubled in a year, making workers one-third more productive and saving around 1.4 hours per day. However, only 3% of organizations report significant gains in efficiency, with 2% seeing improvements in work quality and 4% noticing innovation improvements. The report also warns that AI could increase burnout unless workdays are restructured, as workers will spend more time on cognitively demanding tasks.

TECHNOLOGY.title: How The AI Economy Could Collapse | Prof G Markets - YouTube
TECHNOLOGY.summary: State and local governments are increasingly using artificial intelligence to enhance public service delivery, despite public concerns about the pace of implementation and issues of trust. Only half of residents are comfortable with governments utilizing AI for service delivery, with concerns revolving around security, accuracy, transparency, and fairness. To address these concerns, governments are encouraged to prioritize transparency, focus on digital maturity, and adopt a resident-first approach.
